data.title: Overview of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter introduces the definition, history, basic theories, and research areas of criminal psychology.

items.title: Definition of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is a discipline that studies criminal behavior and its psychological mechanisms, aiming to understand offenders’ psychological characteristics and behavioral motivations.

items.title: Historical Development of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology originated in the late 19th century and gradually developed into an independent discipline alongside psychology and law.

items.title: Main Research Areas
items.text: Includes the causes of criminal psychology, crime type analysis, and psychological assessment and intervention.

items.title: Relationship with Other Disciplines
items.text: Criminal psychology is closely related to law, sociology, biology, and other fields, working together to explore criminal phenomena.

items.title: Biological Theories
items.text: Explore the influence of genetic and neurophysiological factors on criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Theories
items.text: Analyze the relationship between psychological factors such as personality, cognition, and emotion with criminal behavior.

items.title: Sociological Theories
items.text: Study the role of social environment and cultural background in shaping criminal psychology.

items.title: Integrative Theories
items.text: Combine biological, psychological, and sociological perspectives to comprehensively explain criminal psychology.

data.title: Formation of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores how individual factors, environmental factors, and psychological processes influence criminal psychology.

items.title: Genetic Factors
items.text: Study the potential link between genes and criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Traits
items.text: Explore how personality traits such as aggression and impulsivity relate to crime.

items.title: Personality Disorders
items.text: Analyze how psychological disorders like antisocial personality disorder contribute to criminal behavior.

items.title: Early Experiences
items.text: Examine the long-term effects of childhood trauma and family violence on criminal psychology.

items.title: Family Environment
items.text: Explore how family structure and parenting styles shape criminal psychology.

items.title: Social Environment Influence
items.text: Analyze how peer pressure and community environment induce criminal behavior.

items.title: Economic Factors
items.text: Study the relationship between poverty, unemployment, and crime rates.

items.title: Cultural Background
items.text: Explore the impact of cultural values on criminal psychology.

items.title: Cognitive Processes
items.text: Analyze offenders’ thinking patterns, decision-making styles, and their influence on behavior.

items.title: Emotional Processes
items.text: Explore the relationship between emotional regulation, emotional deficits, and criminal behavior.

items.title: Behavioral Motivation
items.text: Study offenders’ internal motivations, such as profit-seeking or revenge.

items.title: Decision-Making Mechanisms
items.text: Analyze offenders’ decision-making process and psychological mechanisms before committing a crime.

data.title: Types of Crime and Psychological Characteristics
data.text: This chapter analyzes the psychological characteristics of violent crime, property crime, and cybercrime.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Murderers
items.text: Explore the psychological motives of murderers, such as emotional conflict or pursuit of profit.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Robbers
items.text: Analyze robbers’ risk-taking tendencies and reliance on violence.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Sexual Offenders
items.text: Study the psychological distortions and behavioral patterns of sexual offenders.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Domestic Violence Offenders
items.text: Explore abusers’ need for control and emotional deficiencies.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Thieves
items.text: Analyze thieves’ opportunistic mentality and material desire.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Fraudsters
items.text: Explore fraudsters’ deception skills and psychological manipulation abilities.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Corrupt Officials
items.text: Study corrupt individuals’ desire for power and moral degradation.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Money Launderers
items.text: Analyze money launderers’ risk-avoidance psychology and strategies to evade law enforcement.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Hackers
items.text: Explore hackers’ technological obsession and defiance of authority.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Online Fraudsters
items.text: Analyze online fraudsters’ impersonation skills and psychological manipulation techniques.

items.title: Psychological Characteristics of Cyberbullies
items.text: Study cyberbullies’ anonymity-driven aggression and hostility.

items.title: Internet Addiction and Crime
items.text: Explore the dependence of internet addicts on the virtual world and its link to criminal behavior.

data.title: Assessment and Intervention in Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter introduces psychological assessment methods and intervention strategies for crime prevention.

items.title: Psychological Testing
items.text: Use standardized tests to assess offenders’ psychological states and personality traits.

items.title: Behavioral Observation
items.text: Observe offenders’ daily behavior to analyze patterns and motivations.

items.title: Interview Techniques
items.text: Conduct in-depth interviews to understand offenders’ psychological history and motivations.

items.title: Case Analysis
items.text: Use case studies to identify offenders’ psychological characteristics and behavioral patterns.

items.title: Psychotherapy
items.text: Provide counseling and therapy to help offenders correct psychological problems.

items.title: Behavioral Correction
items.text: Use behavioral training to modify offenders’ maladaptive behavior patterns.

items.title: Social Support
items.text: Offer social resources to help offenders reintegrate into society.

items.title: Legal Intervention
items.text: Apply legal measures to restrain and punish criminal behavior.

items.title: Early Intervention
items.text: Implement early psychological interventions to prevent potential offenders’ behavioral issues.

items.title: Educational Prevention
items.text: Promote education to enhance legal awareness and psychological well-being.

items.title: Community Prevention
items.text: Strengthen community cohesion through social activities to reduce crime triggers.

items.title: Policy Prevention
items.text: Formulate policies to reduce social inequality and lower crime rates.

data.title: Applications of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores the applications of criminal psychology in criminal justice, crime prevention, and research and education.

items.title: Criminal Profiling
items.text: Use psychological analysis to outline offenders’ characteristics and assist in case investigation.

items.title: Interrogation Techniques
items.text: Apply psychological methods to improve interrogation efficiency and obtain truthful confessions.

items.title: Witness Psychology
items.text: Study witnesses’ psychological states and their impact on testimony credibility.

items.title: Jury Decision-Making
items.text: Analyze jurors’ psychological processes and their effects on verdicts.

items.title: Crime Prevention Strategies
items.text: Use psychological intervention and social support to prevent criminal behavior.

items.title: Prison Psychological Rehabilitation
items.text: Provide psychological treatment to inmates to correct problems and reduce recidivism.

items.title: Community Corrections
items.text: Use community support to help offenders reintegrate and reduce reoffending risk.

items.title: Recidivism Prevention
items.text: Use psychological assessment and intervention to lower the likelihood of reoffending.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Research
items.text: Advance understanding of criminal psychology through scientific research.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Education
items.text: Educate professionals to improve the application of criminal psychology.

items.title: Professional Training
items.text: Train judicial personnel in psychological knowledge and skills.

items.title: Academic Exchange
items.text: Promote international collaboration and development through academic exchange.

data.title: Future Development Trends
data.text: This chapter discusses future directions of criminal psychology in technology, interdisciplinary cooperation, and ethical challenges.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence and Criminal Psychology
items.text: Use AI to analyze criminal data and improve crime prediction capabilities.

items.title: Big Data Analysis
items.text: Apply big data to uncover patterns and psychological traits in criminal behavior.

items.title: Virtual Reality Technology
items.text: Use VR to simulate crime scenes and study offenders’ psychological responses.

items.title: Neuroscientific Research
items.text: Explore the biological basis of criminal behavior through neuroscience.

items.title: Psychology and Law
items.text: Enhance collaboration between psychology and law to improve scientific judicial practices.

items.title: Psychology and Medicine
items.text: Combine psychology and medicine to deepen understanding of criminal psychology.

items.title: Psychology and Sociology
items.text: Integrate psychology and sociology to comprehensively analyze crime phenomena.

items.title: Psychology and Information Technology
items.text: Combine psychology with IT to develop new tools for crime prevention and intervention.

items.title: Ethical Issues
items.text: Explore ethical dilemmas in criminal psychology research and potential solutions.

items.title: Privacy Protection
items.text: Study how to protect personal privacy in the application of criminal psychology.

items.title: Data Security
items.text: Analyze data security risks in criminal psychology and protective measures.

items.title: Future Challenges
items.text: Discuss potential technological and social challenges in the future development of criminal psychology.
